item.title: Here's what the Netflix-Warner Brothers deal means for consumers
item.description: News that Netflix plans to buy Warner Bros. in a massive deal is raising lots of questions -- including for consumers.

item.title: Netflix announces deal to acquire Warner Brothers Discovery
item.description: Streaming giant Netflix said it's buying Warner Bros. Discovery in a deal that would create a global entertainment behemoth. CNN and other cable channels Warner Bros. owns are not part of the deal.

item.title: Appeals court hands Trump a victory, OK'ing firings of two independent agency heads
item.description: The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled 2 to 1 that President Trump's firings of Democratic members of the Merit Systems Protection Board and the National Labor Relations Board were lawful.

item.title: EU hits Elon Musk's X with $140 million fine over business practices
item.description: The fines were due to the platform's misleading use of blue check marks to identify verified users and a lack of transparency over ads and data access for researchers.

item.title: Netflix will buy Warner Bros' studio and streaming businesses for $72 billion
item.description: The merger, announced Friday, would bring two of the industry's biggest players in film and TV under one roof. Beyond its television and motion picture division, Warner owns HBO Max and DC Studios.

item.title: 'New York Times' lawsuit creates a new headache for Pentagon chief Hegseth
item.description: The Times accuses Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth of violating its constitutional rights with a press policy that, the paper says, deprives the public of access to critical national security information.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back fuel economy standards
